summary: This document is an email correspondence regarding the purchase of a property located at 338 East Washington Road in Bradford, NH. It discusses the challenges faced with the seller, the completion of due diligence, and the involvement of legal representatives in the transaction.

persons.name: Steve Marshal
persons.context: Steve Marshal is attempting to purchase a property and is coordinating with legal representatives regarding the transaction.

persons.name: Ted Prizio
persons.context: Ted Prizio is mentioned as the attorney handling the title due diligence for the property purchase.

connections.description: Steve Marshal is seeking legal assistance from Ted Prizio for the title due diligence related to his property purchase.

events.title: Effective Date of Purchase and Sale Agreement
events.description: The effective date of the Purchase and Sale agreement for the property is noted as November 20th.

events.title: Due Diligence Contingency Expiration
events.description: The due diligence period for the title search is set to expire on November 30th.

events.title: Requested Extension for Due Diligence
events.description: An extension for the title due diligence is requested to December 6th due to the seller's unwillingness to extend the deadline.

keyFacts: Steve Marshal is in the process of purchasing a property and is coordinating with legal representatives.
Ted Prizio is the attorney handling the title due diligence for the property purchase.
The effective date of the Purchase and Sale agreement is November 20th.
The due diligence period is set to expire on November 30th, with a requested extension to December 6th.
There is a warning about potential fraud related to wire transfers in the correspondence.
